title: Resolve deployment failure by enforcing valid domain naming rules

requirements.text: Fix the go-live/deployment failure caused by invalid domain formatting by ensuring the deployment domain/slug used for this app is always compliant with the platform constraints: 5–50 characters, only lowercase/uppercase letters, numbers, and hyphens (no spaces, underscores, or emojis).
acceptanceCriteria: Deploy/go-live succeeds without the domain validation error.
The chosen domain/slug is 5–50 characters long.
The chosen domain/slug contains only letters (A–Z, a–z), numbers (0–9), and hyphens (-).
Domain/slug strings with spaces, underscores, or emojis are rejected/avoided so deployment cannot be attempted with invalid input.

constraints: Respect the existing single-actor backend architecture (all Motoko logic in backend/main.mo).
Do not edit any frontend files under the immutable paths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT (compose existing UI components instead).
nonGoals: Adding new birthday-experience steps or changing the fixed step sequence.
Introducing new backend storage or external services solely for deployment naming.
